alert.note: Alert for Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 13 at 7:30AM CDT until July 13 at 9:30AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR SUMTER COUNTY... At 730 AM CDT, Sumter County Emergency Management reported Flash Flooding ongoing in several locations throughout the county, including roads impassible and water going into homes in York. Between 5 and 7 inches of rain have fallen based on radar estimates. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area over the next couple of hours. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that are currently experiencing flash flooding include... Demopolis, Livingston, York, Cuba, Gainesville, Epes, Emelle, The University Of West Alabama, Bluffport, Boyd, Coatopa, Dug Hill, Kinterbish, Geiger, Lilita, Old Mallard Airport, Bellamy, Sumterville, Payneville and Ward. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
